intro: Gymnotheca podolepis, commonly known as the African sand orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with a distinctive three-lobed lip. Gymnotheca podolepis is a perennial herb that is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
